intro: Chrysochlamys dependens var. goudotii, commonly known as the yellow mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically yellow-green in color, and its flowers are small, white or greenish-white, often clustered in inflorescences. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are yellow when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by birds. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
